physical_appearance:This is a gelatin silver print and the image captured show the sky and sea meeting in the horizon. A lone boat (sampan) traverses across the water body
 and in it sits three individuals. The print is mounted on a white backing; spotting and yellowing can be seen along the ridges of the picture and on the white backing itself. A Royal Photographic Society (RPS) Associate 1957 symbol is embossed in the bottom right corner. The artist\u0027s photography studio stamp
 along with the title of the work can be found on the verso.

context_22:c.1956
context_23:1951
context_24:1961
sgcool_label_text:Ho Koon Sang was a member of the Photographic Society of Singapore and an Associate of the Royal Photographic Society in London. This photograph was part of a set of 12 prints sent to the Royal Photographic Society in 1956.

A lone boat (sampan) traverses across the water body, and in it sits three individuals. The print is mounted on a white backing; spotting and yellowing can be seen along the ridges of the picture and on the white backing itself. A Royal Photographic Society (RPS) Associate 1957 symbol is embossed in the bottom right corner. The artist's photography studio stamp, along with the title of the work can be found on the verso.
